url.description: Dependency url. For remote dependencies, this is the git repository url. For local dependencies, this is a relative path on the local machine specifying a git repository. For symlink dependencies, this is the target directory that should be referenced.

source.description: Where the contents of the dependency originate.

version.description: Version of the dependency. Can be a semver version, a commit hash, or any other specifier git supports for checking out a specific commit. If not specified, the latest version will be used. If no version is specified, the dependency will be checked out at the latest commit of the default branch.

subfolder.description: Relative path to the directory of the dependency's source repository or directory that should be treated as the root of this dependency when installed in the project. Specifying subfolders enables compatibility with dependency repositories that place the actual dependency content in a nested folder. Additionally, specifying the same url across dependency entries but different subfolders allows multiple dependencies to be referenced from the same source repository.

path.description: Path to the dependencies folder for your project. Doesn't need to be explicitly specified unless you are doing something non-standard.

dependencies.description: Map of dependencies. Because dependencies can share the same url, a unique name is required for each dependency.
